Course Description: Course includes fundamental theories and algorithms of digital image acquisition, color representation, sampling and quantization, frequency transform via DFT, enhancement, filtering, restoration, analysis, feature extraction, segmentation, morphological transform, and compression. Practical applications such as JPEG compression will be covered.

Course Outcomes.CO1: Students are be able to demonstrate an understanding of fundamental spatial domain image processing
Course Outcomes.CO2: Students are be able to analyze image transforms
Course Outcomes.CO3: Students are be able to apply image processing techniques in spatial and Fourier domain.
Course Outcomes.CO4: Students are be able to analyze spatial and frequency domain properties for compression

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Digital image fundamentals - Human visual system - Digital Image Formation - Sampling and Quantization - Interpolation - Geomteric Transformation
Image processing theory and practice - Registration - Intensity transformation - Histogram processing - Convolution - Spatial filtering
- Fourier transform - Convolution - Sampling and reconstruction - Aliasing - DFT
DFT Properties Filtering in frequency domain
Image Restoration - Noise models - Linear and non-linear filters - Wiener filtering - Constrained least squares filtering - Reconstruction (if time permits)
Image Segmentation - Point, line and edge detection - Thresholding

Resource Material.Textbook: Gonzalez and Woods, Digital Image Processing, 3rd edition, Prentice Hall, 2008
